name: smiles
description: Parse, build, and manipulate SMILES molecular notation. Create molecules programmatically using Ring, Linear, and FusedRing constructors, or parse existing SMILES strings.

tools.name: parse_smiles
tools.description: Parse a SMILES string into an AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) that can be manipulated and converted back to SMILES

smiles.description: SMILES string to parse (e.g., 'c1ccccc1' for benzene, 'CCO' for ethanol)

tools.name: build_smiles
tools.description: Build a SMILES string from an AST node object. Use this after modifying an AST from parse_smiles or constructing one programmatically

ast.description: AST node object with type, atoms, size, substitutions, attachments, etc.

tools.name: decompile_smiles
tools.description: Convert a SMILES string to JavaScript constructor code using Ring, Linear, FusedRing, and Molecule constructors

smiles.description: SMILES string to decompile to constructor code

tools.name: validate_roundtrip
tools.description: Validate that a SMILES string can be parsed and regenerated with 100% fidelity

tools.name: get_common_fragments
tools.description: Get a list of pre-built common molecular fragments and their SMILES representations
